001package ca.gc.cra.radar.infrastructure.protocol.http;
002
003import ca.gc.cra.radar.application.port.FlowAssembler;
004import ca.gc.cra.radar.application.port.MetricsPort;
005import ca.gc.cra.radar.domain.net.ByteStream;
006import ca.gc.cra.radar.domain.net.TcpSegment;
007import java.util.Optional;
008
009/**
010 * Basic HTTP flow assembler that forwards non-empty TCP payloads as ByteStream slices, preserving
011 * direction and timestamps. Future iterations can enhance this to perform true reassembly.
012 */
013public final class HttpFlowAssemblerAdapter implements FlowAssembler {
014  private final MetricsPort metrics;
015
016  /**
017   * Creates an HTTP flow assembler adapter.
018   *
019   * @param metrics metrics sink for assembler statistics
020   * @throws NullPointerException if {@code metrics} is {@code null}
021   * @since RADAR 0.1-doc
022   */  public HttpFlowAssemblerAdapter(MetricsPort metrics) {
023    this.metrics = metrics;
024  }
025
026  /**
027   * Emits a {@link ByteStream} for each non-empty HTTP payload while recording metrics.
028   *
029   * @param segment HTTP segment to evaluate; may be {@code null}
030   * @return stream slice when payload is non-empty; otherwise empty
031   * @implNote Emits one {@link ByteStream} per segment; higher-layer reassembly occurs elsewhere.
032   * @since RADAR 0.1-doc
033   */  @Override
034  public Optional<ByteStream> accept(TcpSegment segment) {
035    if (segment == null) {
036      metrics.increment("http.flowAssembler.nullSegment");
037      return Optional.empty();
038    }
039
040    byte[] payload = segment.payload();
041    if (payload.length == 0) {
042      metrics.increment("http.flowAssembler.emptyPayload");
043      return Optional.empty();
044    }
045
046    metrics.increment("http.flowAssembler.payload");
047    metrics.observe("http.flowAssembler.bytes", payload.length);
048    ByteStream slice =
049        new ByteStream(
050            segment.flow(),
051            segment.fromClient(),
052            payload,
053            segment.timestampMicros());
054    return Optional.of(slice);
055  }
056}
057
